title: Drawing, "Design for a Metal Candelabrum of Four Branches, for Louis XV's Service", ca. 1730
medium: Graphite, pen and black ink, brush and wash on paper, framing lines in pen and black ink
provenance: From the Collection of Léon Decloux
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: The royal French coat-of-arms is on the base. Two putti carry a bracket on which stands a vase. The branches and flower boughs spring from a volute on top of the vase. Fleurs-de-lis rise from the volute.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for a Metal Candelabrum of Four Branches, for Louis XV's Service", ca. 1730.
ca. 1730. Graphite, pen and black ink, brush and wash on paper, framing lines in pen and black ink. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1911-28-274.
